## RLog.withCorrelationId() method

Returns a new [RLog](./rlog.rlog.md) with the correlation\_id set to `correlation_id`<!-- -->.

Correlation IDs are appended to log messages when present, for further tracking beyond [tags](./rlog.rlog.withtag.md)<!-- -->. Especially useful when tracking control flows across services or files.

To learn more about Correlation IDs, see [child](./rlog.rlog.child.md)<!-- -->.

**Signature:**

```typescript
withCorrelationId(correlation_id: string): RLog;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

correlation\_id


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The new correlation\_id to use.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[RLog](./rlog.rlog.md)

The new [RLog](./rlog.rlog.md) instance.

## Example


```ts
const logger = new RLog().withCorrelationId("12345");

logger.d("Hello world!");
// > [DEBUG]: "Hello world!"
// > { correlation_id: "12345" }
```
